title: Kate Fischer hits out at ex-fiance James Packer
text:
She's the four-time Vogue cover-girl who famously became engaged to casino magnate James Packer in the late 1990s.
And Tziporah Malkah, formerly known as Kate Fischer, has taken a swipe at her ex-fiance, claiming that she hates being defined by their highly-publicised relationship.
Appearing on Wednesday's edition of The Project , the 43-year-old, who now works as a nurse's aid, said: 'I hate talking about him, I hate being defined by him. I actually had done quite a lot of work and a lot of it was quite good and I had a very promising career'.
'I hate being defined by him': Tziporah Malkah, formerly known as Kate Fischer, has taken a swipe at her ex-fiance, claiming that she hates being defined by their highly-publicised relationship
I had to stop work': Tziporah, a successful model before meeting James, claimed she was told she had to stop working as it was 'tacky' for his wife to work
'I feel like I was a bud snapped off the vine before I had the time to bloom.'
Interviewer Carrie Bickmore asked: 'Was it a sacrifice you chose to make or a sacrifice that you felt that you were being encouraged to?'
'Oh no, I had to stop work,' Tziporah replied, before claiming that James had told her it was 'tacky' for his wife to work.
Instead, the bride-to-be immersed herself in decorating their new home, coffee catch ups with friends and 'shopping'.
Opening up about the relationship, the model admitted the pair were so in love, they had planned their lives together, including how many children they would have and what their names would be.
However, it wasn't all rosy for the couple, with the brunette beauty talking about what she believes was the beginning of the end for the pair of almost five years.
'I feel like I was a bud snapped off the vine before I had the time to bloom': Tziporah spoke about her regret at abandoning her career for love but admitted it's a sacrifice she chose to make at the time
'Out of the loop': Tziporah spoke about what she believed was the beginning of the end of her relationship with James, as he became busier and more stressed.
After insisting on a holiday as just the two of them, instead of the usual group of 30, Tziporah says his friends 'turned on me'.
She also noted that her ex was under so much pressure at work he would come home and not talk to her, with Tziporah saying she was 'needy' and felt 'out of the loop' in six months.
'It it was like, "it's too hard to have you in my life, you can be Mrs Packer and have all the credit cards, you can do whatever you want, but you have to let me do whatever I want".
'And that's not a marriage - that's not the sort of marriage I want,' she noted.
Revealing chat: The brunette beauty opened up to Carrie Bickmore (right) about her career, relationship with James and her journey from Hollywood to homelessness
Shortly after Tziporah split with the billionaire, James married model Jodhi in 1999 before divorcing three years later.
The businessman went on to marry Erica in 2007 and they had three children together, before splitting in 2013 after six years.
His most recent relationship was with Mariah Carey, with whom he split late last year after an engagement that lasted less than a year.
Glamorous past: Tziporah is a four-time Vogue cover-girl who famously became engaged to casino magnate James Packer in the late 1990s
Following James and Mariah's split, Tziporah penned a bizarre open letter to his ex Mariah Carey offering advice on how to win the playboy back.
'My advice to you is, if you really want him back play the game, let him make the key decisions and you may well live happily ever after as Mariah Carey Packer,' Kate wrote in New Idea .
She added if the casino magnate is 'having a sulk,' leave him alone for a couple of days then contact him.
Former flame: His most recent relationship was with Mariah Carey, with whom he split late last year after an engagement that lasted less than a year
She also said that Mariah was 'lucky' she didn't have to meet his late father, media mogul Kerry Packer and that she and his mother Roslyn struggled to get along.
'I tried hard to get along with her, but really, the only thing we had in common was our love for James,' she wrote.
It comes after she seemingly took a swipe at James on her Facebook page, calling him an 'attention wh**e'.
'Let him make the key decisions': Following James and Mariah's split, Tziporah penned a bizarre open letter to his ex Mariah Carey offering advice on how to win the playboy back
'James Packer will do ANYTHING to continue to be associated with me!' she wrote.
'And who can blame him? The whole world knows that I'm the most interesting thing that had and will ever happen to him.
'Attention wh**e that he is,' she concluded.
